data.title: Giallo etymology in Italian
data.meta_description: Italian word giallo comes from Latin galbus (Yellow.), Latin -inus
data.text: -inus Latin (lat) Of or pertaining to; -ine; usually indicates a relationship of position, possession, or origin. giallo Italian (it) (of a story) involving crimes and detective work. Yellow Amber, yellow (traffic signals). Detective fiction, detective novel, detective story; crime fiction; whodunit; pulp fiction. Mystery, (police) case. The colour yellow.
